channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Friday's jobs report is expected to show the slowest pace of hiring in years
item.description: Economists expect the Bureau of Labor Statistics to report that payrolls expanded by just 100,000 on the month.

item.title: Apple sales rise 6%, company seeing early iPhone 16 demand
item.description: Apple reported earnings after the bell. Here are the results.

item.title: China's Zeekr reports EV deliveries in October nearly doubled, clocks its best monthly numbers
item.description: Several major Chinese electric car companies are yet to release deliveries data for October.

item.title: European markets higher as oil and gas stocks lead gains; shipping giant Maersk up 4%
item.description: European markets were higher on Friday, starting November on a positive footing as traders await an all-important U.S. jobs report.

item.title: Nasdaq 100 futures rise as investors parse latest tech earnings, await jobs data: Live updates
item.description: The three major indexes finished Thursday and October's trading month in the red.

item.title: Amazon CEO pledges AI investments will pay off as capital expenditures surge 81%

item.title: Chevron beats earnings expectations, returns more than $7 billion to shareholders
item.description: Chevron's stock is largely flat for the year, underperforming the S&P 500 energy sector which has gained more than 6%.

item.title: Boeing, union reach sweetened contract offer in bid to end strike, vote scheduled for Monday
item.description: The unionized machinists walked off the job on Sept. 13, halting most of Boeing's aircraft production.

item.title: Apple's services unit is now a $100 billion a year juggernaut after 'phenomenal' growth
item.description: Apple's services business has become a critical part of the company's appeal to Wall Street over the past decade.
